titleStmt.title: Laban T. Moore et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5533

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlett
Govener of Kentucky Your Petitioners would respectfully represent that at the April Term of the Boyd Circuit Court 1863, Abraham Adams was fined sixty dollars for Keeping a Tippling House

Your petitioners would further represent that before the trial of the case in the circuit court a warrant was issued by a justice of the peace of Boyd County and at the trial a Judgment was rendered against the said Abraham Adams for Sixty ^Twenty^ dollars and this was for the same offence that the said Abraham Adams was tried before the circuit court, and for which he was fined in said court the said Adams plead the former conviction and the justices hopes could not be obtained and his plea was rejected, since the conviction the papers have been found in the hands of
H W Norris Esqr a justice of the peace of this county They further represent that said Abraham Adams is a poor man with a large family and he has ceased to keep a tavern and sell whisky and is now trying to make a living by manual Labour we there for pray your Excellency to interpose executive clemency and remitt the said fine in so much thereof as can be lawfully remitted,

Laban T Moore
J. D. Jones County atty
C S McConnell Judge Boyd Co Co
Jas W Riely clk B C C
Jeremiah Wellman
James Langston
M W Noris J P R C
Wm Ely,
Remit all except fees and own costs. A previous conviction has been in the same case
